Privacy Policy

We are committed to respecting your privacy. This policy sets out who we are, the kind of information we may collect and hold, and how that information is used.

1. Who are we?

Corporate Games P/L organises various corporate sports championships in Australia. The provision of services and information to you may also involve companies related to CG P/L and/or third party companies.

2. Contacting us

You may change any of the personal information we hold concerning you at any time. To do this, please contact us via email at info@corporategames.net.au or call on (02)8354-0216 with your request. You may also contact us in this way if you no longer want to receive update bulletins and information.

3. Credit Card Payments

To authorise an online payment, financial information (including your credit card number, expiry date, payment amount, card security code and the name on your credit card) is captured by our website.

Your credit card number, expiry date and CSC are used only for the duration of the payment authorisation process. For security purposes your credit card number, expiry date and CSC are not permanently stored within the Corporate Games database at any time.

Once your credit card payment has been processed, Corporate Games has no record of the credit card number or expiry date you used. However, the name on the card, payment amount and purpose of payment is stored permanently as part of your payment record.

We may use your IP address to identify online payments, administer our web site and to assist in diagnosing problems with our server.

Credit Card Security

Corporate Games uses a variety of security measures to maintain the safety of the credit card information you provide.

Our website uses Secure Socket Layer (SSL) technology to encrypt all data transmission between your browser and our server. Our website is hosted within a secure operating environment that is protected by a firewall. Our secure operating environment is not open to the public.

For security purposes your credit card numbers are never stored permanently within our databases. This means we do not have a permanent repository of credit card numbers that may be vulnerable to an attack by a hacker.

4. Who has access to information?

Personal information collected and stored by CG P/L will be used in connection with the events organised by CG P/L.

We may also pass on your details to third parties who assist us in management of the events, but only in so far as it is necessary to deliver the services to you.

We may also disclose or access personal information where:

(a) we believe in good faith that it is required by law, or

(b) if you are involved in an accident where we need to provide the information to first aid, medical personnel, hospitals, law enforcement, insurers or the like.

5. The information we collect

We only collect and store information about you and team members, when you enter an event. We are not able to enter anyone in the event without their name, date of birth, address, and contact details - we need this information to identify you and in the event that an accident occurs.

Where applicable, any credit card details submitted to us will not be kept, recorded or passed on to any third parties other than for the transaction it is intended for.

In order to improve our services to you, we ask some of our customers to voluntarily complete questionnaires. If you do not wish to answer one of our questionnaires, simply decline when asked.

Your personal details may also be used to send update bulletins and information about our events, about CG P/L and its related entities, and our sponsors' third party goods and services. Please note that you can elect not to receive these bulletins and information at any time (see #2 Contacting Us above).

We may also collect your personal information when you enter any of our promotions or prize draws. If you do not want to receive promotion-related information, you can decide not to participate in the promotion or prize draw.

6. Web Sites

An CG P/L web site may contain links to other sites that are not managed by CG P/L. If you are in doubt as to whether a link is to a corporategames.net.au site, please check the address displayed on your browser bar.

Other sites which may be accessible through our web site have their own privacy policies and data collection practices. We cannot accept responsibility for any information you may divulge to non-CG P/L sites.

7. Security

CG P/L seeks to take all reasonable security measures to safeguard against risks of loss, unauthorised access, destruction, use, modification or disclosure to or of any personal information you have disclosed to us.

Our 'secure sites' always begin with the URL headings https:. Please note that any personal information you wish to send us outside of these secure areas may be subject to the ordinary risks of unencrypted internet communications.

Please be aware, if you are contacting us via the internet or email that unfortunately, no data transmission over the internet can be guaranteed to be 100% secure. While we strive to protect your personal information, we cannot ensure or warrant the security of any information you transmit to us and you do so at your own risk. Once we receive your transmission, we take all reasonable steps to ensure its security.
